title: REQUEST: Wide SOCKS4 support
author: lars18th
body_snippet:
Hi,

A lot of different requests/PRs exist related to TUNNEL and PROXY connections. See #420, #1907, #1568, etc. In fact the discussion over this functionality it's very old.

So, as the project is relaunched, I want to suggest to mark the WIDE SUPPORT OF SOCKS4 as high priority. Let me to explain what signifies this support:
- For _every_ TCP connection, it will possible to connect directly or through a SOCKS4 proxy server.
- Then you can tunnel directly any connection using for example a...

comments.snippet:
I've read your initial post and I share the same problem, being able to connect using a socks proxy. Been using freerdp on Linux with great success (which supports proxy connection). Unfortunately the windows binary (wfreerdp) doesn't run on my W10, no matter which build i try.

I came here thinking mRemoteNG was capable, but it wasn't ≡ƒÿƒI will go with WSL2 and xfreerdp instead.
comments.author: agail

comments.snippet:
Hi,

I want to request if the "medium priority" label can be changed to some with higher priority. The reason is because the current implementation (nightly build) is great. And now using a SSH sever connected to the Internet and the LAN where are our server are, then we can connect to them. This is true with all protocols, including the RDP protocol. Great!
However, when the bridge for the access is not a public SSH server but a VPN with a HTTP/SOCKS proxy we can't use the MRNG.

Then, as ...
comments.author: lars18th
